<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

<details><summary>Increase in tech debt: (relative, absolute) = (1.00, 0.02)</summary>

|Current number|Change|Type|
|-:|:-:|:-|
|56|1|disabled deprecation lints|

Current commit [b724d2f619](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/b724d2f6192c0bd9b37a3590fa2c794044365ef3)
Reference commit [eb9d9b39a4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/commit/eb9d9b39a42ac6b69b6f2c56de429cb31ac80e69)

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

Thanks so much for doing this!

bors d+

Thanks so much for doing this!

bors d+

IIUC each of `α` and `β` still get their own universe even if we write:
```suggestion
theorem card_congr {α β : Type*} (f : α ≃ β) : card α = card β :=
```

```suggestion
theorem card_image_of_injOn {α β : Type*} {f : α → β} {s : Set α} (h : Set.InjOn f s) :
```

```suggestion
theorem card_image_of_injective {α β : Type*} (f : α → β) (s : Set α)
```

```suggestion
-- The remainder of this section is about the deprecated `PartENat.card`.
```

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: introduce ENat.card, and use it in place of PartENat.card
